citeinfo.origin: Russia (Federation). Ministerstvo prirodnykh resursov. Head Research Information Computer Center
citeinfo.title: Geologic Boundaries Russia 1998

descript.abstract: This polygon dataset represents geologic regions in Russia.
descript.purpose: This dataset is intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and may be used for basic applications such as viewing, querying, and map output production, or to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data.

idinfo.accconst: Restricted Access Online: Access is granted to licensee only. Available only to Tufts University affiliates.

cntorgp.cntorg: Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment of the Russion Federation

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

attracc.attraccr: Attribute information remains the same as given by the author of the data. However, when information is missing or ambiguous, the GIS Information Systems Center at Tufts University researches other metadata sources for explanations. If sufficient information is unavailable, "unknown attribute" is given as the definition. If the attribute has been created through a geoprocessing function, "geoprocessed identifier" is given. If the attribute is known, but the values are not, "unknown" is given for values. Features' units of measurement are determined if not already given.

procstep.procdesc:
Changed name from Geo_poly to RussiaGeologicBoundaries98
This data layer was created by completing the following changed to the original tiled data: >Merged all geo_poly coverages to create one file for all of Russia >Collapsed repeating auto-generated fields >Preserved original feature ID, and all other attributes >Dissolved by GEO_ID to combine shapes that were separated across tiles. Summed areas and perimeters during this dissolve step, and used the first (same) value for both legend fields, Age and Geo codes, Err and Priz.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdefs: Tufts University. Geographic Information Systems Center

attr.attrdef: The area of geologic feature in square miles.
attr.attrdefs: Tufts University. Geographic Information Systems Center

attr.attrdef: Perimeter of geographic feature in decimal degrees.
attr.attrdefs: Tufts University. Geographic Information Systems Center

attr.attrdef: Numerical legend code for geologic epoch
attr.attrdefs: Tufts University. Geographic Information Systems Center

edom.edomvd: Middle and lower pilocene (Cimmerian and Pontian)
Permian and upper and middle Carboniferous
Kurulian series of the Aldan sheild, upper part of elomor series of the Baltic sheild, Kapchan series of the nabar sheild
Analog of Kurulian series of the Aldan sheild, upper part of Belomor series of the Baltic sheild, Kapchan series of the Anabar sheild
Dzeltulin series of the Aldan sheild, upper Anabar series of the Anabar sheild
Analog of Dzeltulin series of the Aldan sheild, upper Anabar series of the Anabar sheild
Timpton and Dzeltulin series of the Aldan sheild, upper Anabar series of the Anabar sheild
Timpton series of the Aldan sheild undivided, upper part of the Belomor series of the Baltic sheild
Analog of Timpton series of the Aldan sheild and Daldin series of the Anabar sheild
Fedorov series of teh Aldan sheild
Lengir series of the Aldan sheild, lower part of Belomor series of the Baltic sheild and their analogs

attr.attrdefs: Tufts University. Geographic Information Systems Center
Tufts University. Geographic Information Systems Center

attr.attrdef: Numerical legend code for geologic epoch of feature, same value definitions as FIRST_NUML
attr.attrdefs: Tufts University. Geographic Information Systems Center

attr.attrdef: Numerical legend code for type of geological feature, same value definitions as FIRST_NU_1
attr.attrdefs: Tufts University. Geographic Information Systems Center

edom.edomvd: Cover Quarternary sediments more than 100 meters thick over mapped underlying deposits
Coal-bearing deposits (shown by letter "h" in from of the age index)
Volcanic rock of various composition (undivided), mainly lava
volcanic rock of various composition (undivided), mainly tuff
Outlines of astroblems, shown in scale (color and index inside outline show age of the structure)
Astroblems out of scale (color and index outline show age of teh structure)
Linear features of structues from satellite images
Ring features from structures of satellite images
Boundaries between facies and carieties of rocks
Gabbro-dolerite, dolerite, gabbro-diabase, and picrit diabase
Nepheline, and pseudo-leucite syenite, ijolite, urite,, nepheline pyroxenite, ferrucite
